div.h1: Badger school is closed until May 1, 2020
div.h3: If you have questions, please feel free to contact you child’s principal.
div.p: Badger High School – Mr. Steven Kochemba
Badger Middle School – Mr. Bill Hamilton
Badger Elementary School – Dr. Mary Jefferson-Gough
Hello and good evening Badger Braves. We have three announcements for you.

If you know an families new to our district, they can begin the registration process by calling our new hotline (330) 876-2808. We can enroll families right away in our schools contact-free! Please help us spread this important message.
We are proud to continue serving free meals to the families on our free or reduced meal plan. Parents can pick up their meal package(s) for the week this Monday and every Monday 10:00-11:00 on our circular drive by the American Flag. If you are part of our backpack program, let us know when you arrive, and we have those ready too! Simply pull up, stay in your car, and we will be happy to bring everything to you.
This next last message is for our Elementary students. This Monday, April 13 from 10 am – noon, Elementary students may pick up new April work packets and return completed March work packets in front of the Elementary office. Third quarter report cards will also be attached to your student’s packet. For anyone unable to make it to the school during this time, there will be an additional pickup hour this same Monday evening from 6-7 pm. For parents wishing to access materials remotely, these packets will be posted on our school website as well as on the Remind app. Completed March packets may be held by parents or emailed to your child’s teacher if you prefer not to visit the school in person. Report cards not picked up will be mailed to your home or may be emailed to you upon request. Thank you. Happy Easter, Stay Safe, Be Healthy and Always Be Brave.

Hello Badger Braves. Our governor has ordered us to stay at home. Sometimes we move. Any family new to our district can begin the registration process by calling our new hotline (330) 876-2808. We can enroll your children right away in our schools contact-free! Please help us spread this important message.

Hello Badger Braves. These are tough times for many of our families in many ways. Many of our families are experiencing layoffs, reduction in hours, and even loss of employment. We want you to know that you can apply for meal assistance any time that your income levels change. A form will need to be completed. It can be found on our district website and we have also sent you an email. You can either mail the form or bring it to us any Monday from 10-11 by our flagpole. We will also be at the school to answer questions.

This next message is for our Elementary students. On Monday, April 13 from 10 am – noon, Elementary students may pick up new April work packets and return completed March work packets in front of the Elementary office. Third quarter report cards will also be attached to your student’s packet. For anyone unable to make it to the school during this time, there will be an additional pickup hour Monday evening from 6-7 pm.

For parents wishing to access materials remotely, April packets will be posted on our school website as well as on the Remind app. Completed March packets may be held by parents or emailed to your child’s teacher if you prefer not to visit the school in person. Report cards not picked up will be mailed to your home or may be emailed to you upon request. Thank you Braves and stay safe.

Good evening Badger Braves. We are proud to continue serving free meals to the families on our free or reduced meal plan. Each child will receive ten nutritious meals for the week during our days away. Parents can pick up their meal package(s) for the week this Monday and every Monday afterwards that we are closed from 10:00-11:00 on our circular drive by the American Flag. If you are part of our backpack program, let us know when you arrive, and we have those ready too! Simply pull up, stay in your car, and we will be happy to bring everything to you. Have a wonderful day Braves.

Our School District is proud to be able to continue to serve the needs of our community during these difficult times by providing two nutritious meals a day for each child on our free/reduced meal plan during our days away. Parents can pick up their meal package(s) for the week beginning tomorrow and every Monday afterwards that we are closed from 10:00-11:00 on our circular drive by the American Flag. If you are part of our backpack program, let us know and we have those ready too! Simply pull up and we will be happy to help you load your car. Have a wonderful day Braves.

Our first day of providing meals to our students on the free/reduced list was a marvelous success and we are proud to say that we will be continuing this service. Each child will receive ten nutritious meals for the week during our days away. Parents can pick up their meal package(s) for the week this Monday and every Monday afterwards that we are closed from 10:00-11:00 on our circular drive by the American Flag. If you are part of our backpack program, let us know when you arrive, and we have those ready too! Simply pull up, stay in your car, and we will be happy to bring everything to you. Have a wonderful day Braves.

HS and MS Students can plan on beginning their remote instruction tomorrow. Parents, please remind your children to check their badger braves email and their individual teacher’s Google Classrooms. Their classroom teachers will be communicating directly to each student using these platforms. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact your child’s teacher, school counselors, or building principal via email. We are here for you. We continue to wish everyone in our community the very best of health. Good night Braves.

We will be opening our school this Monday, March 23rd from 5:00 – 8:00 in the evening for students and parents to pick up any belongings, including books, materials, and musical instruments. If your student needs a laptop, we can issue a computer for anyone needing one. Thank you Badger Brave families! Thank you for helping to make this work. We miss seeing you. We will call again on Sunday. Good night.

We would like to invite any of our students to come to the school to grab what they need from 9:00-12:00 on Monday. This includes laptops. If your student does not have a laptop, we can certainly provide one. Middle and high school Students are reminded that their school email accounts will be a source of a great deal of vital information over the next few weeks. Students please use this week to catch up on any work that needs done and to enjoy some time with your families. Next Sunday, we will reach out to all of you with information on how to obtain the necessary information for new assignments., We encourage you to reach out via email to your teachers or principals with any questions.

Good evening. This is Ed Baldwin and I’d like to say a few words. We are in the midst of a truly historic chapter in history. This afternoon our governor announced a three-week closure of all Ohio schools. He also issued a ban on all gatherings of large groups of people. As a best practice and to honor the spirit of our governor’s order, Badger will join all Trumbull County schools and many others across the state in closing immediately. There will be no school tomorrow and for the next three weeks. In addition, all extracurricular activities and other events here at school are suspended indefinitely. We’re proud to say our children’s teachers spent this afternoon preparing to provide instruction to our students digitally. We expect to provide you additional information over the next few days regarding a number of topics using both the auto-call system and your email addresses. There will be much to discuss over the next few days and weeks but in the meantime please allow me to wish all of the families in our school district the very best.
Hello to all of our Badger Braves Families.

With recent developments and increasing concerns related to the coronavirus, our district has been working very closely with the Trumbull County Board of Health, the Ohio Department of Health and other local officials to ensure the health, safety, and well-being of all of our students.

As a county, we have established steps to determine when a school should be closed. We have a plan in place to communicate information about any school closings and the processes for cleaning and disinfecting our facilities.

Our teachers are working on alternative instructional plans should the need arise. We would ask your families to begin to plan for arrangements should the District be forced to interrupt normal operations.

There is much more information linked on our website. We encourage you to review it. Please know, we will continue to utilize our all call system, website and social media accounts to communicate with you.
div.div: The Joseph Badger Local School District will provide academic excellence to all students through an effective and challenging learning environment that encourages students to become independent thinkers and lifelong learners. The new Joseph Badger School opened September 5, 2006 with the first day of classes for students. Badger Elementary, Middle and High School form a 175,000 square foot state of the art K-12 facility that services the largest geographical school district in Trumbull County. Students attending the Joseph Badger School, named after a circuit riding minister, Reverend Joseph Badger reside in Gustavus, Hartford, Kinsman, Orangeville or Vernon Township.

div.p: There is also a small population of open enrollment students attending from neighboring school districts. Joseph Badger offers a diversified curriculum including Kindergarten/Enrichment and college preparatory courses which include five high school advanced placement (AP) classes. Badger Middle School is one of the select schools in Ohio to offer three grade eight classes earning high school credit; French, Algebra and Intro to Physics and Chemistry. Joseph Badger offers a comprehensive co-curricular program coinciding with academic offerings and an interscholastic sports program which personifies team play, opponent respect and continued sportsmanship in all contests.

hr.h4: The Joseph Badger Local School District Board of Education, with assistance from Hilltop Securities Inc., refinanced its outstanding Series 2012 Various Purpose Bonds to take advantage of favorable bond market conditions. The $5,880,000 refinancing will save District taxpayers $441,095 over the life of the bonds, approximately 6.212% in present value savings The Series 2012 Bonds were originally a refinancing of the District’s Series 2003 Various Purpose Bonds. The 2012 refinancing resulted in gross debt service savings of $513,185 over the life of the bonds. In total, the two refunding bond issues have saved the Joseph Badger Local School District taxpayers $954,280 over the life of the bonds. The Board of Education, Superintendent Baldwin, and Treasurer Sciola want to take every opportunity to reduce taxes to the constituents they serve, and with favorable bond market conditions, this refinancing provided a great opportunity to save money for the community.

div.p: 5/22 Last Student Day – 1 Hour Early Dismissal
